column1: The Purple Pig////roasted bone marrow with herbs - I grew up eating bone marrow
column2: no joke. Cantonese people love making soups out of big bones and we'd suck on the bones for the bone marrow
column3: which is believed to be highly nutritious. So in my memory
column4: there is no way bone marrow would not taste good. This dish is a bit of a let-down because of my familiarity with the food. If you have never tried bone marrow
column5: you should give it a try. The consistency and almost buttery flavor of the bone marrow are so unique you would appreciate that there is complimentary bread and salt. Essentially it is like a spread now that I think more about it... rather expensive spread
